title: Ticket #4502: Memory leak in find_scope_id
description:
find_scope_id (/src/condor_utils/ipv6_interface.cpp) leaks memory. ifaddr should be passed to freeifaddrs when we're done with it. In practice this is a small leak, but under certain cases when handling errors this function can be called in a loop and eat all available memory.

There are probably easier way to reproduce, but this works for me:

  1. Get a machine with IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Link-local is fine. The following steps assume your IPv6 address is fe80::21e:4fff:fe9d:98f4 ; change as appropriate.
  2. Set: 
    COLLECTOR_HOST = [fe80::21e:4fff:fe9d:98f4]:9618
NETWORK_INTERFACE = fe80::21e:4fff:fe9d:98f4
DAEMON_LIST=MASTER
ENABLE_IPV6=FALSE
ENABLE_IPV4=TRUE
  3. run condor_master
